faqSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Renting Commercial Shops in Sector 63A
faqSection.description: Find quick answers to the most common queries regarding lease agreements, operational costs, and the commercial viability of Sector 63A Gurugram.

faqs.question: What is the typical lock-in period for a shop rental agreement in Sector 63A
faqs.answer: The standard lock-in period for commercial shops in Sector 63A generally ranges from 12 to 36 months, depending heavily on the size of the unit and the specific demands of the landlord. For high-investment units like F&B outlets or large showrooms, property owners may require a longer lock-in period to secure their investment and mitigate frequent turnover. We highly recommend clarifying this clause early in the negotiation process, ensuring it aligns with your long-term business projections before finalizing the lease documentation.

faqs.question: Are there additional maintenance charges besides the monthly rent for commercial spaces
faqs.answer: Yes, nearly all commercial complexes in Sector 63A require tenants to pay Common Area Maintenance or CAM charges in addition to the base rent. These charges cover essential services such as security, cleaning of common lobbies, lift operations, external lighting, and generator backup for shared areas. You should budget for CAM charges which are typically calculated per square foot and clearly outlined in the rental agreement before occupancy.

faqs.question: What documentation is required to finalize a shop lease in Sector 63A Gurugram
faqs.answer: To secure a shop for rent, tenants typically need to provide valid identity proof for all signing partners or directors, the company's registration certificate (GST or proprietorship documents), and bank statements for financial verification. Additionally, the execution of a registered lease deed and payment of the security deposit and first month's advance rent are mandatory steps before taking possession of the commercial space.

faqs.question: How soon can I start my fit-out work after signing the lease agreement
faqs.answer: Generally, fit-out work can begin immediately after the lease deed is registered and the initial payments are successfully processed. However, tenants must first submit detailed architectural plans of their proposed interior modifications to the landlord or the commercial complex management for approval. This ensures that structural integrity is maintained and complex-specific building codes, especially regarding fire safety, are strictly adhered to during the construction phase.

faqs.question: Is Sector 63A considered a high-footfall area for retail business
faqs.answer: Sector 63A is rapidly transitioning into a high-footfall area due to extensive residential construction and its strategic position connecting major areas of Gurugram. While some blocks are already experiencing high traffic, the overall footfall is projected to increase substantially over the next three to five years, making it an excellent location for businesses looking for future growth potential and a developing customer base.

faqs.question: What kind of security deposit is usually required for commercial rentals here
faqs.answer: The standard security deposit required for renting a commercial shop in Sector 63A typically amounts to three to six months worth of the agreed-upon gross rent. This deposit is refundable at the end of the tenancy period, assuming no damages to the property and full clearance of all utility bills and outstanding maintenance dues are provided upon vacating the premises.

faqs.question: Can I obtain a shop with specific provisions for Food and Beverage operations
faqs.answer: Yes, many new commercial developments in Sector 63A have dedicated zones and specific shop units reserved and designed for F&B operations. These units often come equipped with provisions for heavy-duty exhaust systems, separate utility meters, sufficient drainage, and dedicated gas pipeline access, making them ideal for restaurants, cafes, and specialized food delivery kitchens.

faqs.question: Are there restrictions on the types of business allowed in the commercial complexes
faqs.answer: While most standard retail, office, and service businesses are welcome, landlords or complex management may impose restrictions on businesses that generate excessive noise, heavy odors, or require industrial-scale machinery. It is essential to confirm that your specific business activity is approved by the property management before signing any binding rental documents.

faqs.question: How is the rent escalation rate determined in Sector 63A shop leases
faqs.answer: Commercial rental agreements in Sector 63A usually include an annual rent escalation clause. The typical escalation rate agreed upon ranges between 5% and 8% annually, compounded. This rate is usually fixed for the entire duration of the lease term to provide certainty for both the tenant and the property owner regarding future rental obligations.

faqs.question: What are the advantages of renting in a developing sector like Sector 63A over established areas
faqs.answer: The primary advantages include securing larger, modern commercial spaces at significantly lower initial rental costs and benefiting from better parking facilities and superior infrastructure compared to older markets. Furthermore, you gain first-mover status in a rapidly appreciating location, allowing you to establish your brand presence before the area becomes saturated and rates substantially increase.
